etymology.interpretation: Combines the flesh component to signal the domain of body or appearance, while 小 supplies the sound. The sense ‘resemble/likeness’ likely arose from similarity in bodily features and later extended to portraits or images.

examples.chinese: 我们拥有肖像权(我們擁有肖像權).
examples.english: We have the right to one’s portrait (portrait rights).

examples.chinese: 这幅画的肖像很传神(這幅畫的肖像很傳神).
examples.pinyin: Zhè fú huà de xiàoxiàng hěn chuánshén.
examples.english: The portrait in this painting is very vivid.

examples.chinese: 他与哥哥很肖似(他與哥哥很肖似).
examples.english: He closely resembles his older brother.
